title: Musician Goran Bregovic, banned from entering Moldova, denies being close to Moscow
description: The authorities reproached the Bosnian composer for giving a concert in Sevastopol, in annexed Crimea, in 2015.

title: North Korea conducts rocket launch in likely second attempt to put spy satellite into orbit
description: North Korea has fired what it claims is a 'space launch vehicle,' South Korea's military said early Thursday, on day one of a window set by Pyongyang for its second attempt at putting a military satellite in orbit.

title: The paradoxical success of the Grenadier, the ultra-polluting 4x4 made in France
description: Launched by a British billionaire at the head of the petrochemical group INEOS, the car brand with ultra-polluting models has achieved a string of commercial successes.

title: Niger: Did former president Issoufou play a part in the coup?
description: Mohamed Bazoum's predecessor has been criticized for not condemning the putsch led by Abdourahamane Tiani. Some even suspect him of having allowed the commander-in-chief of the Presidential Guard, whom he had appointed, to carry out the coup.

title: Between Estonia and Russia, across the bridge of military trafficking
description: 'The new Russian espionage' (3/5). In Narva, an Estonian town merely separated from Russia by a single bridge, the fear of infiltration and smuggling is omnipresent. Customs and intelligence services monitor the smuggling of military equipment and technology, orchestrated by pro-Russian networks.

title: Wagner chief Prigozhin on passenger list of plane that crashed in Russia
description: Wagner boss Yevgeny Prigozhin was believed to be on board the plane that crashed on Wednesday.

title: Italian pop singer Toto Cutugno, an inspiration for French hits, dies
description: The singer and composer of over 300 melodies enjoyed huge success in the 1970s and 1980s, notably with 'L’Italiano' in 1983. In France, his tunes were used for 'L’Été Indien,' 'Laissez-moi Danser' and 'Méditerranéenne.'

title: Lula attempts to revive the Brazilian automotive industry
description: The Brazilian government has introduced purchase incentives to boost domestic car production, which has been stagnating for several months.

title: Lyon's Musée des Confluences invites you to take a fresh look at African art
description: The exhibition features some 300 sculptures, masks, ritual and everyday objects from the collection of Ewa and Yves Develon.

title: Macron considers referendums as a way to break parliamentary deadlock
description: Government sources say the French President is considering using referendums to pass legislation, which would be the first since the 2005 referendum on the EU constitution.

title: Russian strike on Ukraine school kills four
description: Ukraine's Interior Minister Igor Klymenko said that the bodies of the 'school director, deputy director, secretary and librarian' had been found under the rubble in northeastern Ukraine.

title: Marie Toussaint, the face of France's Greens for the European elections
description: The woman who made a name for herself by successfully suing France for climate inaction will lead the Greens in the 2024 elections.

title: India becomes first nation to land a spacecraft near the Moon's south pole
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi waved an Indian flag on a live broadcast from the BRICS group summit in South Africa to announce the mission's success.

title: French heat wave sets new late-summer record
description: French weather authority Meteo France has announced red alerts for heat in 19 of mainland France's 96 departments.

title: Deadly new fires are ravaging Greece
description: For the second time in the span of a month, the country is facing wildfires. At least 20 people have died in fires fanned by high temperatures and strong winds.

title: Russia: General Surovikin, not seen since Wagner mutiny, reportedly fired
description: State media reported that the head of Russia's aerospace force has been 'relieved of his post' and temporarily replaced Colonel-General Viktor Afzalov.

title: Japan: Final preparations underway for Fukushima water release
description: The power plant's wastewater is set to be released on Thursday, though this has caused anger in neighboring countries.

title: Pakistan floods: Around 100,000 people evacuated in Punjab
description: The Sutlej river in the notherwestern province burst its banks, flooding hundreds of villages and thousands of acres of cropland.

title: Spain: Conservative candidate Alberto Nuñez Feijoo will attempt to form government
description: The leader of the People's Party is unlikely to find the necessary votes. His party won only 139 out of 350 seats, and support from the far-right Vox is unlikely to be enough.

title: Vivek Ramaswamy, a millionaire of Indian heritage looking to shake up the Republican debate
description: In the absence of Donald Trump, the entrepreneur is hoping to use Wednesday's televised debate to close in on Ron DeSantis, currently in second place in the polls.

title: El Niño and La Niña, the 'enfants terribles' of the climate
description: 'The Earth's pulses' (3/6). Combined with climate change, these two climatic phenomena could have even more unpredictable and devastating consequences for many populations.

title: A 10-year-old boy killed in suspected drugs violence in France
description: Local prosecutor Cécile Gensac said Tuesday that the victim's family was 'not associated in any way' in acts of a criminal nature.

title: Canada's exceptional wildfire season made seven times more likely by climate change
description: An attribution study published on Tuesday establishes the link between climate change and the scale of wildfires in Canada, where nearly 14 million hectares have burned.

title: 19 years later, the Millau Viaduct 'has become our very own Eiffel Tower!'
description: The huge motorway bridge in southern France opened to traffic in 2004. Since then, it has become the most-visited site in Aveyron, southern France, and a valuable asset for tourism.

title: Political turmoil in Thailand with return of deposed former prime minister
description: Thaksin Shinawatra, who was accused of corruption after being ousted by the military in 2006, returned to Bangkok just as a new head of government from his political party was elected to parliament the same day.

title: Moscow business center hit in new drone attack
description: For six straight nights, there have been drone attacks in the Russian capital's region.

title: Hawaii fires: At least 1,100 people still missing
description: The deadliest fire in the United States in over a century. Of the 115 bodies that have been found, only 27 have been identified.

title: The Greek island of Poros' fierce opposition to the uncontrolled growth of fish farming
description: Designated by the Greek government as a strategic area for aquaculture, Poros could soon see a quarter of its coastline invaded by fish breeding ponds. Local residents are up in arms against the project, which they believe will negatively impact tourism.

title: Latvia, a Baltic playground for Moscow spies
description: 'The new Russian espionage' (2/5). The small Baltic country that was once part of the Soviet empire is concerned about the activities of the Russian secret services on its territory. A former minister has even been accused of running a spy network.

title: Two Trump co-defendants surrender in Georgia election case
description: John Eastman, a former campaign attorney for Trump, and Scott Hall, a bail bondsman, were booked at the Fulton County Jail, on charges in the Georgia case alleging an illegal bid to overturn 2020 election.

title: Canada's wildfires amplify threats to an already fragile biodiversity
description: The substantial rise in fire frequency, combined with climate change, is disrupting ecosystems already threatened by human activity.

title: Yevgeny Prigozhin reemerges from Russian mutiny in Africa
description: In his first video since the short-lived mutiny, the Wagner mercenary leader claimed to be making 'Africa even more free' and appealing to potential recruits.
